experience: You and Mary both know Mark Fournier

Creates all brand development. Includes conceptualizing company, brand, editorial / content direction, creative messaging, advertising programs and sponsorships. Forges all partner relationships and sells all advertising packages.Serves as spokesperson for brand in media outreach including TV, radio, print and digital. Hosts videos on behalf of clients - national food brands and farm-related companies. Creates script and supervises all video production. Supervises all marketing efforts online and offline.Manages all e-commerce sales in Farm Star Living Shoppe.Closes all business - clients include Sunsweet, Sunkist, Post Hot Cereals, NatureSweet, Taylor Farms, Del Monte, Springer Mountain Farms, Foxy Produce, Living Herbs, Idaho Potato Commission, Wada Farms, Peri & Sons Farms, Fowler Farms, et al. Overview of brand: FARM STAR LIVING is the premiere website and online magazine putting the spotlight on the farmer and world of farms, fresh food and healthy living for mainstream audiences. With thousands of farm-to-table listings and farm fun vacation spots across the USA, Farm Star Living offers proprietary directories that make finding farms and restaurants more accessible than ever. With fresh, original content on Farm Stars, "farming" adventures via agritourism activities, healthy food via recipes, videos, an A-Z Farm Food Health Guide on 200 + fruits and vegetables, blogs, an e-commerce Shoppe and more, Farm Star Living brings the "farm-to-everything" lifestyle to the public. Download our APP, too, and start Farm Star Living!

As Founder, conceptualized, developed, and launched the first national discount consumer website for the spa industry. 300,000 registered-member community was built around aspiration, attainment and health/wellness benefits of the spa lifestyle.Monetized our audience through custom programs for Fortune 500 companies, retail spa advertising, listing fees for over 1000 spa businesses and direct e-commerce. Grew sales to over $1MM in 2007 and averaged over $700K across life of business.Built brand through partnerships with Lifetime TV, Sony Home Entertainment, Conde Nast Publications, O Oprah Magazine, Meredith Corporation and others.Major accounts/ad partners include Procter & Gamble, Blackberry, Johnson & Johnson, Kimberly Clark, GM/Cadillac, American Express, McNeil Corporation, & Starwood. These campaigns were largely custom/self-designed and included themed sweepstakes, loyalty & rewards programs, advertorial content, media placement, e-newsletters, viral video, and more.As noted web-marketing and spa industry expert, extensive public-facing work as spokeswoman, featured speaker, TV host, editor and columnist. Engagements included Extra TV, TV Guide, iVillage, O Oprah Magazine, Meredith TV, Cadillac and Blackberry. Additional coverage included Women's Health, NY Times, Health, Cosmopolitan, Self, Allure, Forbes Traveler.com, InTouch, major-market city publications, network & affiliate TV interviews, radio and websites.Business has entered into partnership with Spas of America, which is now responsible for all aspects of operations.

Sold and developed online programs for Vivendi Universal's online assets. Opened new accounts with numerous major national advertisers, including Chevrolet and Buick, P&G, Nestle Purina, etc. Managed all aspects of accounts, including client relationships, custom programs, surveys, banners, e-newsletters, etc.

Created and sold custom online campaigns for F500 clients including Delta Air Lines, JC Penneys, Kraft, Nestle Purina and others. Created unique programs and cross-promotional campaigns with numerous Disney affiliates which were very innovative at the time. Top revenue producer consistently.

digital marketing was top revenue producer.Generated demand for new media (literally) by developing and presenting seminars to ad agencies and direct clients. Introduced and championed a new advertising innovation -- the ad banner, which had only recently been invented (by WIRED Digital).Covered 14 states including extensive territory of Southeast clients and agencies as well as primary NYC ad agencies, creating ad campaigns for hundreds of clients ␣ Compaq, Philips, NetBank, etc. Included selling first national bank online campaign (ever) for $250k via telemarketing effort(s).

Michael Streefland
Communication & Content Strategy - Facebook Global Marketing Solutions
March 30, 2009, Mary was a client of Michael’s

Michael Streefland has served as a business advisor to my company Spa Addicts.com for two years. During this time, he has helped recreate the brand to take it to a new level, create a new layout and unique approach to the subject matter, create new content sections and categories,  and ultimately a new lifestyle direction to engage and support the female audience. He has been integral to the strategy of  the site overall, as well as creating new sponsor programs and packages that resulted in a key sponsor partnership with Procter & Gamble. Helping monetize my company better than in years previously, he helped create a better revenue model that streamlined and reduced my monthly costs by 70%. Not only has he helped my company become more efficient, he has also supervised creating a more automated process allowing the website to operate at a higher level with less resources. He has helped manage key personnel, helped to assess and redefine employee roles so that each employee would be more productive and efficient. Because of his personable yet professional demeanor, his presence in our offices always inspired our team to contribute more and ultimately has made a better environment for everyone. In addition to his consulting to my business, he has also helped  me identify strategize and identify growth opportunities for my own career development and served as a great mentor as I pursue more avenues for my own personal brand development. Overall, Michael has proven to be not only a key and essential asset to my business’s development and success, but a fantastic person I could count on to provide excellent advice and strategic counsel regarding every aspect of my business.  I cannot recommend him highly enough.

summary: Founder/entrepreneur, business development executive, and brand-builder with approximately 20 years experience specifically in internet media. Experience includes conceptualizing, launching and founding two internet companies. The latest of which is FARM STAR LIVING, LLC, the first lifestyle website dedicated to putting the farmer forefront in the public eye as well as providing a pop culture spin on the world of farming and healthy farm-fresh food. Includes lifestyle features of farmers, national directory of farm to table hot spots, healthy food guide, farm fun activities and national farm finder, monthly content including recipes, blogs, craft cocktails, and videos. Beta version launched January, 2013, and Farm Star Living launched officially in October, 2013.  Experience also includes 10 years as CEO and high-profile public face of Spa-Addicts.com, a profitable, self-funded, vertical-leading media company. Additional 12 years in sales management for blue chip digital publishers. Expertise includes: multi-media content development, F500 account sales, branding/consumer marketing, creation and execution of high-engagement campaigns, travel/leisure editorial & advertorial, and press outreach.Specialties: Internet strategy, content development, sponsor program development, brand marketing, consumer / sponsor promotions, creative theme development, speaking in public venues, on-air video hosting and interfacing with public as brand representative Developing creative marketing solutions for clients of all levelsOn-air expertise in promoting the spa lifestyle to women in such a way that it is accessible and non-intimidating
name: Mary Blackmon
title: CEO, Founder of FARM STAR LIVING
